definitions.definition: the act or process of combining two or more things so that they work together

examples.text: The aim is to promote closer economic integration.
His music is an integration of tradition and new technology.
We are working to bring about closer political integration in the EU.
a milestone in the process of European integration
a move towards greater internal integration in Europe
economic integration within the three communities
integration between research and higher education
policies designed to promote global economic integration

definitions.definition: the act or process of mixing people who have previously been separated, usually because of colour, race, religion, etc.

examples.text: measures to promote the social integration of people with learning difficulties
the use of sport to facilitate the integration of child refugees into society

wordOrigin: early 17th cent.: from Latin integratio(n-), from the verb integrare, from integer ‘whole’, from in- (expressing negation) + the root of tangere ‘to touch’.
